name: Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Cream for Anti-Aging
about: What it is: A silky-soft, powerful age-defying cream for visibly plumper, firmer, and rejuvenated-looking skin...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Dryness, Dullness, Uneven Texture, and Loss of Firmness and Elasticity..Formulation: Cream.Highlighted Ingredients:.- Enzyme Treated Ginseng Saponins (Ginsenomics™): Delivers ginseng’s rejuvenating power deep into skin.- Ginseng Peptide™: Protects skin from external aggressors that can lead to visible aging signs.- Squalane: Supports and nourishes skin’s moisture barrier..Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, and sulfates SLS & SLES...What Else You Need to Know: A powerful anti-aging cream, infused with ginseng peptides and saponin using a proprietary Korean technology. This silky-soft formula glides over skin and improves the look of wrinkles and firmness while helping minimize future signs of visible aging...Clinical Results: In an 8-week clinical study on 32 women (ages 38 to 49):.- Skin firmness visibly improved by +4.7%.- Skin was visibly lifted by +11.4%.- Fine lines and wrinkles were visibly reduced by +19.9%
ingredients: -Ginsenomics™: Sulwhasoo’s signature ginseng saponin improves the look of wrinkles and firmness while ginseng peptides help protect skin from environmental stressors...Water / Aqua / Eau, Glycerin, Squalane, Butylene Glycol, Cyclopentasiloxane, Trehalose, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Glyceryl Stearate, Phytosteryl Isostearyl Dimer Dilinoleate, Octyldodecyl Myristate, how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-After applying serum, warm a pea-size amount between your fingertips, then gently press into skin to maximize absorption.

reviews.review_text: I have been using the Sulwhashoo Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Cream for a little over two weeks. My skin feels so soft and silky. It soaks into the skin so easily! My fine lines are much less pronounced.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This rich and luxurious face moisturizer has transformed my skin! The Sulwhasoo Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Face cream absorbs effortlessly, quenching my skin's thirst for hydration and leaving it feeling supple and soft. The concentrated ginseng extract, along with other traditional Korean herbs, has visibly improved my skin's elasticity and firmness, reducing the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. With continued use, my complexion looks brighter, smoother, and more radiant than ever before. Its a bit pricey but there’s a good quantity that’s could easily last months and if your going to invest in something investing in yourself should be number one . It's truly a game changer for anyone seeking a premium anti-aging skincare experience!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this consistently for almost 2 weeks now and absolutely love it! I love the consistency of it, it’s creamy and rich but absorbs right into the skin. The scent is so therapeutic and relaxing. I noticed how glowy and supply my skin looks with daily use.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using Sulwhasoo's Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Cream for the last few weeks and absolutely love it! I figured this cream would be a bit too thick for my combo/oily skin, but it's not. This cream absorbs quickly and feels lightweight on the skin. The texture is so luxurious. I love how soft and smooth my skin feels after applying. My skin appears plumper and more hydrated. This does have a strong ginseng/herbal scent, but it doesn't last for long. Overall, this cream is a little pricey, but if you have the money, it's worth the splurge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of the Sulwhasoo Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Cream and liked it so much that I purchased the 0.33 oz. product size. I went with the mini due to the price point. I wanted to make sure it worked for my skin before investing further. I’m so glad I gave it an extended try because I feel in love with it! While some others don’t enjoy the scent or feel it’s too strong, I really enjoy it. To me, it is pleasantly herbal and fades away after a few minutes. The cream is medium-weight—not too heavy and not too light. And at 49, my skin has changed in the last year and is much drier than before. This cream does a lovely job of adding lasting moisture without feeling heavy or greasy. I’ve had no breakouts or irritation at all. I’ve since purchased the Bestsellers Kit and the Cult Classic Set, so you could say I’m committed!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wrote a detailed review twice, but the app crashed and never posted it, so I'm writing again.  Third time's a charm...  I've been using the cream for about half a year and really like it. It has a smooth texture that melts into the skin once it spreads on the face. It leaves me very nourished and radiant, and I swear it makes my cheeks slightly rosy (due to ginseng's properties). I have normal to dry skin and can use this throughout summer and winter without issues. If you're oily, this might be too much in the summer, but I still don't think it's heavy in the traditional sense. It is not a lightweight fluid or gel cream, though; it is a cream through and through. I use retin-a and get chemical peels often and have not had any issues so far, and I like to pair it with the Classic Cream at night, which is a bit thicker and more potent.    One last thing, it smells like ginseng. If you don't like herbal scents, you might not like this, but it doesn't linger like perfume does; it's just how ginseng smells.

reviews.review_title: Miracle, solved a mystery skin issue
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This moisturizer resolved a mystery skin condition I had been suffering from for nearly a year, and the timing was perfect as I received a sample of this stuff the WEEK before I was attending the most important event of my life: wedding. I had dark crusting skin spread over the sides of my face and my whole forehead, I figured since the steroid cream I was given didn't work, when this arrived, I just put it on overnight, and woke up to all the affected skin on my face PEELING OFF like a snake. I was so perplexed that I immediately looked up to buy thi stuff to use, saw the price, silently closed the page, and thought it would be that. I managed to find a source to purchase this stuff directly from Korea for a fraction of the price, so I am pleased to say, if you want this, get it from Korea! Knocking the star off for Sephora pricing this so high when it could be so much less (definitely still expensive, but not insane like this) [I'm sure the story will sound fake, but I did end up seeing a dermatologist immediately after the big even, got biopsied, diagnosed and put on antibiotics to clear up the rest of the affected skin that I didn't get to apply this cream onto. This cream just saved me from having to deal with hundreds of relatives seeing and getting scared of what happened to me.]

reviews.review_title: A must-have in my skincare routine
reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product was gifted to me by Sulwhasoo. I’m so happy to try this Korean skincare brand.  As soon as it arrived, I unboxed the package and incorporated it into my nightly skincare routine. I apply this cream during the nighttime. I use it for my last step in my skincare routine. After washing my face, toning it, and adding serum. I apply this cream to my face and neck and sleep with it overnight. This method allows the cream to absorb into my skin adding moisture that my skin desperately needs! The Sulwhasoo Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Cream has made my combo skin feel nourished and  super soft. It removed my dryness in my cheek area while making my face and neck area feel firm. However, this cream is for all skin types. The scent of this product is a ginseng scent and it’s not overwhelming. The cream is a lightweight consistency and not sticky, which is a positive for me. The texture of the cream is smooth, which is what I tend to like. I plan to continue using this as my nighttime moisturizer cream and ordering the larger size based off of my positive results I’ve noticed within a short time.  Thank you to Sulwhasoo and this renewing cream for my skin flex.

reviews.review_text: This moisturizer is outrageously expensive, and there’s pretty much no non-prescription cream that can drastically change your skin. Knowing that, this is something to possibly splurge on if you have the money, but nothing to go broke over. Like other people stated in other reviews, it does have a strong scent that I describe as “horse’s hoof” that very quickly dissipates, pretty much as soon as it hits your face. I also think it smells a little bit like ashwagandha tincture, if you’ve ever smelled that. I appreciate that the smell seems “natural,” as in, what the ingredients likely smell like without any cover-ups. As for performance, it has a great texture that sinks in well and doesn’t feel heavy on my face, but as fall approaches, I don’t necessarily feel it gives hydration more than any other “normal” priced moisturizer. Gifted by Sulwhasoo.

reviews.review_text: I have been waiting for a chance to try Sulwhasoo's renewing cream for a while now, so of course, when I got the opportunity to try it as a gift, I jumped on it! First off, a little goes A LONG way here. Which is almost required given the price tag associated with the cream. It's very lightweight and if you're prone to greasy or even sensitive skin, you're safe here. Since we're still in the Fall season, not sure how this will be added to my winter skin routine.  It has a nice clean spa-like scent to it, but the fragrance doesn't irritate one's skin. I have sensitive skin, so this is something I pay close attention to. This product is very nice, leaves your skin looking healthy, and gives you a dolphin-skin (think dewy skin) look with only one product! The only downside I have to this is the price - it's a lot. If you aren't fully committed I recommend going for the trial size instead.  This is complimentary from Sulwhasoo, so I was lucky to have this given to me, but I can see why people buy this item.

reviews.review_text: The 'La Mer' of Korean skincare and something I've been itching to get my hands on for a while! It's lightly hydrating, unlike the 'Classic' version which is richer and more suited to drier skin types. It sinks right in and doesn't leave me with an oily film on my face - which is what usually happens with most moisturizers that I try. It probably helps that I don't use a huge amount of the product. Before I apply the cream, I use a few drops of the 'First care Activating Serum', allow it a few seconds to absorb and immediately follow with the Concentrated Ginseng Cream. From all the Korean skincare products I've been treating myself to recently, this one is definitely one of my favorites, though I do prefer the 'Classic' version over this one as I found it to be more hydrating, whilst going easier on the perfume and silicones (Dimethicone is much lower in the ingredients list!). During the time that I've been using this brands' products, my skin feels more hydrated, more radiant and luminous. Go with this version if your skin veers more towards combination. 'Classic' if your skin needs more hydration, or is sensitive to silicones.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. Hair Loss Treatment: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Hair Oil  2. Shampoo: 'Sephora Collection' - Deep Cleaning Shampoo 3. Face Mask: ‘Peter Thomas Roth’ – Pumpkin Enzyme Mask  4. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Facial Treatment Serum 5. Face Scrub: ‘Sisley' - Botanical Gentle Buffing Cream 6. Lip Balm: ‘Nuxe’ – Reve De Miel Lip Balm 7. Lip Liner: ‘Sephora Collection' - Rouge Gel Lip Liner

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I'm in my mid-30s with oily, acne-prone skin, and I've been on the hunt for a light, anti-aging moisturizer. This. Is. It. It has a very light texture (a little goes a long way) that absorbs very quickly but still feels nourishing. As other have noted, it has a light floral, herbal scent. I tolerate but don't usually love fragrance in skincare, but I've come to love the smell of this (though people with sensitive skin may want to stay away). The cream itself is also light enough that I can use it both in the morning and the evening, even with my oily skin. I purchased the mini version first to test it out, and after a month of regular use (morning and evening), I shelled out for the full size. I've noticed that my tired, uneven, drab looking skin looks like I'm wearing makeup when I'm not. It's more even, resilient, bouncy, and radiant. My pores look smaller and when I do have hormonal breakouts, this does seem to calm the inflammation. If you're in your 20s with great skin, I don't think this product would do much for you, but for me it's worth the investment. Also btw, this product was recently reformulated and Sephora hasn't updated the ingredient deck. The new version has no retinol -- the Sulwhasoo website has the correct ingredient list, which I matched up against the box I received. This, along with the First Care Serum, is a standout product that is actually worth the high price tag.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Have this cream and it changed my life! It really transforms the skin to a soft subtle surface of beauty-fullness! You definitely need this in your skincare routine and the ginseng smells AWESOME! the smell goes away after the dry time but it’s not too overpowering so definitely recommending this to everyone I know. 5 stars seriously!

reviews.review_title: Smells like being in a grave, I suppose...
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried a few sample packets of this product with recent orders, applying a small amount day and night consecutively for a few days, and the first thing I noticed was its foul odor; this stuff STINKS, like dirt or potting soil... the awful smell alone was very offputting. That aside, I do not believe there were any positive effects on the skin. My face just looked shiny (like oily, not a good sheen) and sunburnt. Would not recommend, especially at such a high price for that putrid stench... I don't understand, because I've always enjoyed the flavor of ginseng tea, I did not expect it to stink so badly...

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: (gifted  by Sulwhasoo) Omg I’m obsessed! My skin has been very dry since winter and this is extremely hydrating! My skin is so hydrated and supple after applying it. I definitely recommend this product if you have dry skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Great for a day or night cream. It is lightweight and feels good on the skin. I have oily skin with dry patches and this is doesn’t make me look or feel greasy at all. This product was gifted by Sulwhasoo

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is my 1st time trying a high end (over $200) moisturizer / cream; it's definitely an amazing experience. My skin age group / skin type: over age 45, mature, very dry, hyperpigmentation skin type; I would definitely recommend -if you can fit this in your skincare budget. I'd like to share, it does have an evident fragrance (which I do love). The texture is lightweight, creamy, & absorbs almost immediately. My skin looks apparently radiant & feels exceptionally moisturizing. It's wonderful! * gifted by Sulwhasoo sample size.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This cream is literally the best. The sample sized bar that I was gifted was far too tiny, I can definitely see myself buying the full size product when I fully run out which will be inevitably soon! Complimentary from Sulwhasoo.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love how hydrating this cream is. It leaves my skin feeling so smooth and hydrated. It’s great on my dry skin. I was in the hunt for a moisturizer that actually felt like my skin was absorbing it. I was excited to try it. This was gifted by Sulwhasoo but I will Definitely a must on my skin care routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Concentrated Ginseng Renewing Cream   I received this small product sample from complimentary from Sulwashoo. Initial application the smell is pretty strong but then it gets subtle after a few minutes. The cream is light to medium I’d say, it’s not thick but not so thin also. It dries down pretty fast and it’s good for using under the makeup. It’s smooth I’d say and not greasy for a cream.  I just think it’s too little it’s a very tiny container (5mL) to really tell and conclude how this product performs wish I could have had enough more time to use this product before I pcould really conclude my thoughts on this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This cream was kindly gifted by Sulwhasoo. This is one of my all-time favorite anti-aging creams. The Ginseng Renewing Cream helped my skin to recover and hydrate during the winter months.  It’s definitely pricey but a little goes a long way.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Gifted by Sulwhasoo this eye cream is incredible. It was my first time ever using this  and I really really liked it. This eye cream makes the skin supple and soft. It also makes the skin look firmer, smoother and more refreshed. I really saw the difference in my dark circles and would definitely recommend this eye cream.

reviews.review_title: Works great, smells like old lady
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of this with my last order. I applied it before bed and woke up with the most amazing skin I’ve had in my life. However, it smelled like an old lady’s purse. I kept waiting for the smell to fade, but it never did. I was almost at the point where I wanted to wash it off so I would stop smelling it. However, I can’t complain about the results!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin

Complimentary  from SULWHASOO
